decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990. | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing / document title number(s):

0161-EX-00 Revision A (Existing Location Plan); 0161-EX-20 Revision C (Existing Elevations); 0161-EX-10 Rev C (Existing Floor Plans); 0161-PR-00 Revision C1 (Proposed Location Plan); 0161-PR-10 Revision C1 (Proposed Floor Plans); 0161-PR-20 Revision C (Proposed Elevation)

Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning. | The proposed extension to accommodate additional office space, shall remain ancillary and connected to the main industrial use of the premises and shall not be subdivided to create a separate planning unit.
Reason: To protect the integrity of the Locally Significant Industrial Site and to prevent the introduction of non-conforming uses, in accordance with Policy E6 of the London Plan.
| All external materials to be used in the development hereby approved shall be as per those described in the submitted application form and plans listed in Condition 2.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D3 and D4 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2023). | Prior to use, shutters shall be installed with proprietary anti-vibration isolators to prevent structural or airborne vibration noise being transmitted to noise sensitive premises and the closing mechanism shall be buffered to adequately silence the operation of the shutters.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of surrounding premises is not adversely affected by vibration or noise, in accordance with Policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012), policies 7A & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D14 of The London Plan (2021), Ealing SPG10 and the National Planning Policy Framework (2023). | Control measures shall ensure that the following standards are implemented
- noise and vibration (according to Approved CoP BS 5228-1 and -2:2009+A1:2014),
- dust (according to Guidance by the IAQM (2024) for Guidance on the assessment of dust from demolition and construction),
- lighting ('Guidance Note 01/20 For The Reduction Of Obtrusive Light' by the Institution of Lighting Professionals),
- hours of work and all associated activities audible beyond the site boundary restricted to 0800-1800hrs Mondays to Fridays, 0800 -1300 Saturdays (no work on public holidays),
- neighbour liaison, notifications to interested parties and considerate complaints procedure,
- public display of contact details including accessible phone numbers for persons responsible for the work for the duration of the works in case of emergencies, enquiries or complaints.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of surrounding premises is not adversely affected by noise, vibration, dust, lighting or other emissions from the site, in accordance with Policies 7A and 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and policies).
subdivision_of_building: rear ( north side ) of the building
description: Construction of top floor extension to rear to use as office; external alterations to the north elevation involving the installation of a new roller shutter plus 2 new pedestrian entrance doors inside the shutters; subdivision of existing warehouse into 2 units and associated internal alterations
